notesStmt.note: Parchment recto white with slight usage stain; verso naturally darker, and dirty at outermost end. Small tear where membrane attached to short roller. Edges slightly dirty, and tiny diagonal creases at edge. Edge slightly rolled over in part. Abrasion/pressure mark at top inner end. Some vertical creases toward inner end. Ink flaky/abraded in first few columns, with some text illegible. Ivory canister yellowing. Dirt in bone lacunae, turnings and inaccessible areas.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 19th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: D. Mocatta: presented by him to the British Museum on 19 March 1840: inscribed on the verso.
